Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Starting with Part 1, the normative process rules. The strict sequence is: Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant [If Approved: Finalize Documentation] Close Case. The key constraints are the order of these steps, especially that Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment, and after Loan Decision, Inform Applicant has to happen. Also, if approved, finalize docs before closing; if rejected, dont finalize and close directly.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So for each case in the event log, I need to check if they follow this sequence strictly.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at Case 1: The steps are in order: Application, Credit Check, Risk Assessment, Loan Decision (Approved), Inform, Finalize Docs, Close. That seems to follow the rules perfectly. No violations here.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2: Application Received, then Risk Assessment without a Credit Check first. Thats a violation of the ordering rule (Credit Check before Risk Assessment). Then they do Credit Check later, but thats out of order. Then Loan Decision (Rejected), then they Finalize Documentation which is not allowed after rejection. So two violations here: incorrect order and finalizing after rejection.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3: Application, then Credit Check two days later. The desideratum says within 24 hours, but thats not a normative rule. So no normative violation there. Then Risk Assessment, Loan Decision (Approved), Inform Applicant two days later (desideratum violation again, but not normative), then Finalize and Close. The sequence here seems okay: all steps in order, approved leads to finalize before close. So no normative violations here, just desiderata.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now Part 2, desiderata. These are timing and the follow-up call. Case 2 might not have desideratum issues since the violations are normative. Case 3 has Credit Check delayed beyond 24 hours and Inform Applicant delayed beyond 48 hours. Also, no Follow-up Call.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait, let me double-check Case 3s sequence. Application, then Credit Check on 14th (two days later), then Risk Assessment, Decision, Inform on 16th (two days after decision), then finalize and close. The order is correct. No skipped steps or wrong order. So only desiderata issues.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 2s steps: Application, Risk Assessment (without Credit Check), then Credit Check, Loan Decision, Finalize (after rejection), Close. So two normative issues: wrong order (RA before CC) and finalize after rejection.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For desiderata, Case 3s delays and missing follow-up. Also, maybe Case 1 is perfect, so no desiderata issues. Case 2s steps might have timing issues but since the main violations are normative, the desiderata might not be highlighted unless specified.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So summarizing: 1. Normative violations: Case 2. 2. Desiderata failures: Case 3 (delayed CC, delayed Inform, no Follow-up). 3. Justifications: For Case 2, maybe procedural error or mistake in ordering. For Case 3, delays could be due to workload or operational issues, follow-up call might have been done outside the log.
